[1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0].Name: Stewart Aitchison
[1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0].Interests: Nonlinear Guided waves: Spatial and temporal solitons, All-optical switching and signal processing, Optical frequency conversion and parametric interactions. Novel optoelectronic materials and photonic microstructures for linear and nonlinear applications. Optoelectronic Integration: Hybrid Integration, monolithic Integration and integrated bio-sensors for lab-on-a-chip applications.

[1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0].Name: Amr Helmy
[1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0].Interests: Photonic device physics and characterization techniques (lasers, modulators, amplifiers, switches), non-linear optics in III-V semiconductors (second and third order ultrafast non-linearities), applied optical spectroscopy for III-V optoelectronic devices and materials (spatially and temporally resolved photoluminescence and Raman), III-V fabrication and monolithic integration techniques (dry etching, quantum well intermixing, oxidation).

[1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0].Name: Peter Herman
[1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0].Interests: Our research group studies and develops novel laser processing technology for defining photonic devices, optical circuits, microfluidic and other nanostructures. The laser enables fabrication in novel two- and three-dimensional architectures to be explored in optical materials for broad impact in today's optical communication networks and lab-on-a-chip microsystems.

[1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0].Name: Nazir Kherani
[1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0].Interests: Materials and devices research and development program in the areas of thin film amorphous silicon and carbon and emerging nanocrystalline materials for application in the fields of renewable-sustainable energy (photovoltaics and hydrogen as an energy vector) and micro-opto-electronics (rigid and flexible substrates).

[1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0].Name: Lothar Lilge
[1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0].Interests: Dr. Lilge's research is focused on enabling/improving: 1) the use of light for clinical diagnostic and/or therapeutic applications, and 2) the use of light as a microscopic tool for biomedical research.

[1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0].Name: Joyce Poon
[1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0].Interests: The objectives of our research are twofold. On the one hand, we are interested in practical applications where we integrate micro/nanophotonic devices with other technologies, such as electronics and microfluidics, for miniaturized platforms for high bandwidth chip-to-chip communication and sensing. On the other hand, we seek to explore the fundamental physical properties of micro/nanophotonic devices to the quantum level.

[1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0].Name: Li Qian
[1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0].Interests: Photonic material, devices, and components - Novel semiconductor materials, ultrafast optical phenomena in semiconductors, ultrafast optical switching devices, micro-optical packaging; Advanced optical amplifier technology - extended bandwidth amplification, transient gain control, module integration and miniaturization, high concentration erbium-doped fibre amplifier modeling.

[1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0].Name: Edward Sargent
[1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0].Interests: Semiconductor quantum electronic and photonic devices - lasers, detectors, modulators, novel functional devices; Photonic systems and networks - device-systems interactions and requirements (TDM, WDM, Optical CDMA), optical network topologies; Novel materials and structures - photonic crystals, polymer-based active and passive electronic and photonic devices. Combined theory, modelling, and experiment of physical mechanisms, materials, devices.

[0, 0, 0, 0, 1, 0].Name: Jason Anderson
[0, 0, 0, 0, 1, 0].Interests: My interests are in the area of computer hardware design, and specifically, on architectures, circuits, and computer-aided design (CAD) techniques for integrated circuits (ICs), especially FPGAs. I'm particularly interested in finding new and clever ways to reduce chip power consumption. I'm also interested in novel applications of FPGAs, in the computing and embedded domains.

[0, 0, 0, 0, 1, 1].Name: Baochun Li
[0, 0, 0, 0, 1, 1].Interests: My research interests are in areas related to the provisioning of Quality-of-Service (QoS). These include challenging research problems across the medium access control (MAC), network, middleware and application layers. In other words, my interests encompass traditional areas of networking, middleware architectures and multimedia. For further information, please refer to my web page: http://www.eecg.toronto.edu/~bli

[0, 0, 0, 0, 1, 1].Name: Ben Liang
[0, 0, 0, 0, 1, 1].Interests: My research interests are in developing theories, algorithms, and protocols for wireless and mobile communication networks.

[0, 0, 0, 0, 1, 1].Name: Jorg Liebeherr
[0, 0, 0, 0, 1, 1].Interests: Self-organizing peer networks. I am interested in developing and evaluating a new network protocol architecture based on design principles of self-organizing peer networks that may provide the foundation for a new communications infrastructure. The long-term objective of the proposed project is to evolve peer network protocols and design principles into a possible follow-on technology to the Internet protocols.

[1, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0].Name: Steve Mann
[1, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0].Interests: Image processing, photoquantigraphic rendering, WearComp ("wearable computing" as described in http://wearcomp.org/wearpubs.html, algebraic projective geometry (as described in http://wearcam.org/orbits/, personal imaging (wearable camera and video systems, as well as laser EyeTap systems), new frameworks for signal processing, time-frequency analysis, wavelets and chirplets, signal processing for miniature body-worn radar systems based on symplectomorphisms of the Weyl-Heisenberg group, HCI (human-computer interaction), situationist approaches to first-person documentary video (detournement of the traditional human-machine interaction paradigm), inventing the camera of the future.
[1, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0].TagB: Photonics and Semiconductor Physics, Control, Communications and Signal Processing
